learning_outcomes.description: Critically analyse how well regions work as systems to address their quality of life goals (Courageous thinkers).
Engage effectively with regional stakeholders to elicit required information for systems analysis (Connected citizens).
Critically reflect on their own personal skill needs to effectively and ethically lead sustainable and resilient regional systems (Respectful leaders).
Communicate with regional stakeholders in ways that demonstrate empathy with their challenges and opportunities (Influential communicators).

assessments.task_description:
Part 1

For 4 services you have been exposed to, write 1-2 pages addressing the following:

  • What is the mission of the organization?
  • What distinct needs does it address for the region?
  • Who are the customers of the organization and what are their needs?
  • What does the organization do well?
  • What challenges does it have?
  • Based on your studies, what recommendations can you offer for how the organization may better meet its challenges?

(Feel free to include your own area of specialization/interest eg. tourism, entrepreneurship)

Part 2

In 3 pages, now reflect on how the region works as a system or not by answering the following:

  • Is there an entity in the region which assumes ownership of the whole system of organizations? If so, which entity?
  • What mechanisms do they use to coordinate the various sectors, organizations, services?
  • How does the system balance deliberate coordination with allowing the system to self-organise organically?
  • Is there any evidence that this entity adopts a strategic approach to its regional system leadership? (how it secures its short and long term sustainable quality-of-life future?)
  • How do they measure the success of their regional system?
  • Can you offer any advice as to how the region could benefit from better systems leadership?
  • What are the strengths and weaknesses of your recommendations?

(If you were unable to collect data on these questions then please state how you could collect data, who from and what sorts of questions you would ask in order to get answers).

In your answer you must include the following three papers (1 paragraph each. Explain their key messages and use to analyse Lockyer Valley. Insert into your text wherever suits you). Use them to help analyse how well Lockyer Valley is working as a system:

Welch, C. & Anderson, L. 2017. Place matters: The role of placemaking in economic development. International Economic Development Council. (You only need to read Pages 1-12 only)

Newey, L.R. & Coenen, L. 2021. Lock-in, paradox and regional renewal. Regional Studies, https://doi.org/10.1080/00343404.2021.1976745.

Broadhurst, K., Ferreira, J. & Berkeley, N. 2021. Place leadership: developing a model to guide regional partnerships. Regional Studies, 55(3): 556-567, DOI: 10.1080/00343404.2020.1836343

1.5 line spacing

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please refer to the Learn.UQ site for a detailed assessment task sheet and submission instructions.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
In no more than 5 pages (excluding title page, references, appendices), write about:

  • What have been the highlights of your Lockyer Valley immersion experience and why?
  • What new things have you learnt?
  • What have you learnt about how to achieve the long-term sustainability of regions?
  • What theories etc from your current degree program have helped you in this experience?
  • What gaps in your own leadership skillset have you noticed that you think you’ll need for the workplace?

1.5 line spacing

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

The field trip will be the primary data source for completing Assessments. Students are to use the field trip to gather the data to answer all Assessment questions.
